Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by stating that the US had no access to the Cuban lung cancer vaccine due to sanctions, when in fact limited access was available after the normalization of relations.
Understate: The claim understates the effectiveness of the Cuban lung cancer vaccine by not mentioning that it extended life by about three months in trials.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide evidence or data to back up the statement about the US having no access to the vaccine due to sanctions.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes the problematic assumption that the US had no access to the Cuban lung cancer vaccine solely because of sanctions, without considering other factors that may have influenced access.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the limited access to the Cuban lung cancer vaccine, such as regulatory requirements or the need for further research and replication of results in the United States.
